page.title: 16Godalming in 1945
page.content: In 1945 the schools had their own garden. The children who went to Moss Lane had what is now Waitrose carpark. The children had to go to school until they were 14. School ended at 4.00pm. The food used to be mostly the same. There wasn't so many sweet and fancy things. The bread used to be 2 or 3 pennies. There used to be lots and lots of sweet shops but no supermarkets. There were hairdressers and in the barbers the men and boys were given a short back and sides in no time at all. People mainly travelled by bus or horse and cart, there were no cars. The population was much smaller. Boys wore short trousers. Men wore leather shoes and thick shirts and wide trousers. They wore more hats and caps in those days.
